Contract Review

JPMorgan Chase is using Generative AI (COiN) to automate the review and analysis of legal contracts. The technology helps to improve the speed and accuracy of contract reviews and reduces the risk of errors or oversights.

Contract Center

Ally piloted a system in June and July 2023 wherein AI technology transcribes the conversation in real time to the Ally.ai platform and creates a summary of the call. One goal is to relieve the agents of multitasking and let them be more present in the conversation.

Westpac

A chatbot powered by Generative AI assisted customers, 70% of which did not require further support. Chatbot can answer questions about loans and financial topics.

Document Review / content creation

SouthState Bank embraced an enterprise version of ChatGPT to summarize sets of policies, review regulatory documents, compose emails, and create copy for their marketing department.

ChatGPT for Stock Picking

JPMorgan Chase is developing IndexGPT, an artificial intelligence chatbot available for financial advisors to help select investments for customers.

GenAI for Software
Development

Goldman Sachs is experimenting with Generative AI to assist its developers in autonomously creating and testing code.

Knowledge
Management Chatbot

Morgan Stanley launched an Open-AI powered tool that allows its 16,000 financial advisors and call center agents to access Morgan Stanley’s massive collection of research, data and internal procedures easily.

Bloomberg

Bloomberg has launched its large-scale AI model, BloombergGPT. Trained on 700 billion financial data tokens, the tool supports NLP tasks, such as sentiment analysis, news classification or question answering in a fraction of time, in many cases via a single prompt.

Customer Journey

Responsible AI: In Action AI Risks for Banking

  • AI Risks Dimension
  • Value Chain

Bias and Harm

Amplification of the possibility of unfair or biased decisions around marketing offers, credit decisions, service standards, collection / recovery option, and approaches in unmonitored environments

Spread of toxic responses, misinformation, and disinformation

Liability and Compliance

Adherence to varied standards and regulations across the globe that are continuing to be shaped. Current standards, e.g. for MRM, don’t fully address complexities of Gen AIs

Fines, legal action, reputational damage due to improper use, e.g. IP ownership

Unreliable Outputs

Hallucinations, limited traceability and explainability of output

Insufficient disclosure and transparency resulting in a lack of consumer understanding (and potential harm)

Confidentiality and Security

Unauthorized access and/or use of confidential information (PII, Intellectual Property, etc., used to train LLMS)

Increased security vulnerabilities leading to data leakage and inconsistent consumer protection

Sustainability

Increased environmental impacts, e.g., carbon footprint

Propagating bias and disinformation leading to impact on socio-economic environment and enabling fraud at scale

Workforce Transition

Inability of workforce to utilize the full potential of generative Al without appropriate training

Distrust from the workforce that they may be displaced

Product Development and Pricing

Sales and Marketing

Onboarding and Underwriting

Activation, Servicing and Fulfillment

Collections and Recovery

Targeted Email Campaign Creation

Al generates harmful or biased content (e.g.. ethnically, racially, socially biased) that could cause reputational harm. This content could also be against regulatory guidelines

Targeted Email Campaign Creation

Al generates harmful or biased content (e.g.. ethnically, racially, socially biased) that could cause reputational harm. This content could also be against regulatory guidelines

KYC Request for Information Template Creation

Al generate incorrect unreliable content, and may send information to the wrong party thus exposing personal information

Customer Support
Chatbot

Al might generate incorrect content, harmful biased content, or provide confidential information to a fraudulent user

Call Center Agent Assist

Al may generate unreliable content slowing the ability of the agent to respond to the customer, and the Al assist could result in violation of confidentiality and security

Customized Product Generation for Specific Segments

Al-driven product strategies could result in product creation for incorrect or partial customer segments, leading to prejudiced and bias products

Automated Ad
Generation

Al could inappropriately leverage customer data to automate targeted ad generation, which could lead to increased bias and harm as well as potential IP infringement(liability) and reputational risk

Onboarding Chat Agent

An Al-enabled onboarding agent assist for users could result in unreliable inputs by incorrectly asking for customer data or providing incorrect information to the customer

Automated Complaints Response

An Al-enabled complaints response could lead to unreliable and biased information to users based on its creation of feedback resulting in additional reputational risk, regulatory scrutiny, and harm

Sentiment Analysis of Customer calls and Next Best Action

Al-driven product capturing customer sentiment may capture PII and enable a third party to consumer it resulting in confidentiality and security concerns
